modName: World of Warcraft-esque Class Batch files
summary: 10 batch files that bring your character into line with standard WoW classes. Use at level 1. Adds spells and equipment. Trys to remain balanced.
descriptionHtml:
Update: Uploaded a Prestige Death Knight optional file (lvl 32)
------------------

10 (+1 optional) batch files that change your skills, equipment and spells to bring your character closer to the standard WoW classes. Armors used are Steel and Leather or below. Weapons are Steel and Spells are mostly Novice level, a few apprentice level too.

Included is:
Deathknight
Hunter
Mage
Paladin
Priest
Rogue
Warlock
Warrior
Shaman
Druid

Optional file: Prestige Death Knight (lvl 32)

Installation
----------------
Place the batch files into your Skyrim Directory usually located D:\\program files\\steam\\SteamApps\\common\\skyrim. It is the correct folder if it has the file \'TESV.exe\' in it.

Usage
--------
Open the console and type:

bat WoW<class name>

E.g. WoWDeathK for Deathknight, or WoWShaman for Shaman

Best used as soon as your hands become unbound. Also note. when using these files, race only affects your look and racial powers/bonuses since the files reset all skills to 15 (default).


Recommended Mods:
-----------------------------
Daedric Armor and weapon Improvement by GarryG
Frostmourne with and without scabbard by Jojjo

--------
I made this bunch of files for a friend, since he was getting Skyrim for Christmas. And i thought i\'d release it.

I do not plan on updating these files, but it may save someone the effort of making them for themselves.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Keep reading to find out about what the class changes are:


[i]Death Knight (WoWDeathK)

+5
Conjuration, destruction, heavy armor, enchanting, smithing

Health 120, stamina 110, magicka 70

Equipment: Steel Armor, Steel Cuffed Boots, Steel Imperial Gauntlets, Steel Horned Helmet, Steel mace, steel war axe, steel warhammer

Perk: Arcane Blacksmithing

Notes: I removed the block skill and the one handed skill. The reason for this is to add the arcane blacksmith perk to allow you to enchant and improve weapons imediatly. Since a Death Knight had no gear and uses Runecrafting instead. 
---------

Hunter (WoWHunter)

+10
Light armor, archery

+5
block, one handed, sneak

health 100, stamina 100, magicka 100

Equipment: fur armor, fur boots, fur gauntlets, fur helmet, hunting bow, 30 iron arrows, hide shield, steel war axe

Notes: This is probably better named Ranger, because there really are no pets in Skyrim. I used fur armor, because someone who hunts, probably makes his clothes from his prey.
---------

Mage (WoWMage)

+10
alteration, destruction, illusion

+5
enchanting

health 50, stamina 50, magicka 200

Equipment: fine boots, blue robes, staff of firebolt

Spells: candlelight, oakflesh, courage, clairvoyance, fury, frostbite, sparks

Notes: Added the Fireball Staff to allow for a bit more offence at the begining of the game. Otherwise, a generic mage.
---------

Paladin (WoWPaladin)

+10
block, heavy armor

+5
one handed, restoration, two handed

health 130, stamina 100, magicka 70

Equipment: silver sword, steel armor, steel boots, steel gauntlets, steel helmet, steel shield

Spells: lesser ward, turn lesser undead

Notes: I figure a paladin\'s main role is to Tank/Off-heal. Hence the +10 on Heavy Armor and Block
---------

Priest (WoWPriest)

+10
restoration 

+5
one handed, restoration, conjuration, illusion, alchemy

health 60, stamina 60, magicka 180

Equipment: Boots, Monk Robes, steel dagger

Spells: candlelight, oakflesh, courage, clairvoyance, fast healing, healing hands, turn lesser undead

Notes: There really is little need for a healer in a single player game. But i added this to complete the set. Alchemy added to add to healling abillities
---------

Warlock (WoWWarlock)

+10
conjuration

+5
one handed, alchemy, destruction, illusion

health 80, stamina 40, magicka 180

Equipment: fine boots, hooded black robes, silver sword

Spells: equlibrium, fury, frostbite, conjure familiar, raise zombie

Note: I added Equlibrium because it seems to be one of the main selling points of the WOrlock in WoW, converting Health to Mana.
---------

Warrior (WoWWarrior)

+10
block, onehanded

+5
two handed, smithing, heavy armor

health 140, stamina 140, magicka 20

Equipment: silver sword, steel armor, steel helmet, steel gauntlets, steel boots, steel shield.

Notes: Generic Warrior class.
---------

Rogue (WoWRogue)

+10
pickpocket, sneak

+5
one handed, light armor, alchemy

health 100, stamina 100, magicka 100 

Equipment: leather armor, leather helm, leather gauntlets, leather boots, 2 steel daggers

Notes: Generic Rogue/Thief class. Alchemy added for poisoning.
---------

Shaman (WoWShaman)

+10
Destruction

+5
Restoration, Enchantment, one hand, block, smithing

health 100, stamina 70, magicka 130

Equipment: forsworn armor, forsworn guntlets, forsworn boots, forsworn headdress, forsworn  axe, hide shield

spells: flames, frostbite, sparks, firebolt, ice spike, lightingbolt, fast healing

Notes: Destruction added for the \"Nature\" magic, restoration for the Healling side.
---------

Druid (WoWDruid)

+10
Alchemy, Smithing

+5
Light Armor

health 100, Stamina 180, Magicka 20

Equipment: Forsworn Helmet, Forsworn Boots, Forsworn Armor, Fortify Unarmed enchanted Steel Gauntlets, Ring of Hircine

Spells: Werewolf form, water breathing, claws, Beast form

Perks: Heavy armor - Fists of Steel

Notes: Druid is (sort of) intended not to use weapons (hence the \"Claws\", \"Fists of Steel\" and \"Enchanted Gauntlets\"). Not really the best class, since only 1 form is availible
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=[/i]

Prestige Death Knight Optional FIle

Since this is the only Prestige Class in WoW i thought i\'d create a second optional file for anyone interested. It levels your character to Level 32. Adds spells and perks. See description below:
---------

Prestige Death Knight (WoWPDK)

level 32 (2 level ups required)

enchanting 100, smithing 100
Heavy armor 50, destruction 50, Two-Handed 50, One-Handed 50
conjuration 40

health 240
stamina 210
magic 160

Perks: most of the enchanting perks, all the heavy smithing perks, all heavy armor perks below 50, armsman lv 3, champion stance, barbarian lv 3, fighter\'s stance

destruction perks: novice, apprentice, adept, expert, master. Rune master, Impact, Duel casting, frost aligned perks

Spells: All frost spells, soul trap

Equipment: Full set of Daedric Armor, 1 Daedric Greatsword, 1 Daedric War Axe, 1 Daedric Mace,
20 Ebony Ingots, 20 Daedra hearts. (for smithing),
Black Star, Azura Star, 5 Filled Grand Soul Gems, 5 Filled Black Soul Gems (for enchanting)
author: The Shadow of the Phoenix
